Hey there DESTRUCTION123,

I myself have experienced a severe loss streak (I have broken this loss streak) and it can definitely be bothersome. What I found were some of the best ways to deal with this and to get better and back to winning are as follows:

Evaluate. Evaluate your recent games and see what went wrong. Was it your teams fault? Or was it really faults in your own play that contributed to your loss. If you can look back at your games (even if you don't record them but can recall what happened in your head) and think of situations that could have gone better e.g. positioning in a team fight then you're on your way to getting better. Look at where you made mistakes and work on minimising the chances of making the same mistakes in the future.

Take time out of ranked. What comes hand in hand with a  severe loss streak is a loss of enjoyment of the game. Take time out from solo queue and play normals with friends or other game modes that you might find enjoyable e.g. ARAM, Hide n Seek etc. Get that excitement back into the game. You will play better if you have a positive mindset for the game rather than a negative mindset a loss streak might give you. You don't want to queue up for solo queue thinking "here comes another loss". You want to go in thinking "alright, let's break this loss streak and win".

I hope this helps.

Good luck,
GunGale [@DW_GunGale](http://www.twitter.com/dw_gungale)
